intro: Stylophorum sutchuense, commonly known as the Sutchuense False Shamrock, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has a short stem with a single flower at the top, and its foliage is often used in traditional herbal medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
